ARABIC: لَوْ أَرَدْنَآ أَن نَّتَّخِذَ لَهْوًا لَّٱتَّخَذْنَٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّآ إِن كُنَّا فَٰعِلِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If We had desired to have some amusement, We would have derived it from Our Presence, but We did not do that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If We had pleased to make a plaything We could have made it Ourself, if We had cared to do so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Had it been Our will to find a pastime, We would have found one near at hand; if at all We were inclined to do so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Had We wanted to play games, We could have certainly done so with things at hand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: If We willed to choose a pastime, We could have chosen it from Ourselves – if We wanted to.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Had We intended to take a pastime, We could surely have taken it from Us, if We were going to do (that).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Had We wished to make a diversion, We would have made it from before Ourselves: by no means would We do (it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: had We desired to take to Us a diversion We would have taken it to Us from Ourselves, had We done aught.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our presence - if We ever did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Had We wished to find a pastime, We would surely have found it in that which is with Us, if such had been Our will.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Had We intended that We should choose a sport, surely We would choose it from before Us--if We were ever going to do that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Had We desired to take up some diversion We would have taken it up with Ourselves, were We to do [so].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime, We should surely have taken it from the things nearest to Us, if We would do (such a thing)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Had We intended to take a pastime (i.e. a wife or a son, etc.), We could surely have taken it from Us, if We were going to do (that).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Had We wished to take to Us an amusement We would have taken it to Us from Ours had We done so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If We wanted amusement, We could have found it within Us, were We to do so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:17] Had We desired to find some diversion, that which provides diversion, in the way of a partner or a child, We would have found it with Ourselves, from among the beautiful-eyed houris or angels, were We to do [so]. But We did not do so, thus We never desired it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Then Allah revealed the following, when they said that the angels are Allah's daughters: (If We had wished to find a pastime) if We wished to have daughters; and it is said that this means: if We wished to have a wife; and it is also said that this means: if We wished to have children, (We could have found it in Our presence) from Us from among the maidens of Paradise (if We ever did) and We will never do this.
